OrgName.entry: SOUTH YORKSHIRE SERVICE FOR DEAF PEOPLE WITH MENTAL HEALTH NEEDS

Desc.entry: Part of the NHS. Works in conjunction with Mental Health Teams in South Yorkshire to assess and support the needs of deaf (British sign language users) people with secondary mental health needs. Works with people aged 16-65 years or those in contact with services for adults of working age. Available to give advice to people working with older deaf adults or to primary care services. Referrals must be sent to local Mental Health Teams in conjunction with the Deaf mental Health service.
